intro: Obione bunburyana, commonly known as the Bunbury's obione, is a rare and distinctive plant native to Western Australia. It is a small, herbaceous shrub that typically grows in sandy soils along coastal areas. The plant features narrow, linear leaves and produces small, white or pale green flowers during the spring and summer seasons. It is characterized by its unique floral structure and is often found in isolated populations. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
